metadata.title: Deep Ocean Iron Levels, 1997-present
metadata.description: Ambient dissolved and particulate iron levels in the deep ocean; part of a project to determine if iron is limiting to phytoplankton growth in the high-nutrient low chlorophyll waters of the subarctic Pacific Ocean. Surface-1000m
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Measurement of ambient levels of iron in the deep ocean in high-nutrient, low chlorophyll waters to determine if iron is limiting to phytoplankton growth.

Supplemental Information: Risk Justification: Data not secured in regional data centre.
Risk of Loss: Medium
Impact Justification: Data are related to a subject, location or species of concern within the scientific,  government or public community within the last 5 years.
Impact of Loss: Medium
Recommended Action: Obtain access to data and bring to archives.
Additional Info: After the data are published, they may become available, if the Japanese collaborators agree to their release.

Status: In work

Maintenance frequency: None planned

Access constraints: Private

Use constraints: Collaborative data collected with Japanese Scientists.

Distribution liability: [unknown]

FGDC metadata date: 20080207

FGDC metadata standard: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

FGDC metadata version: FGDC-STD-1998-1

Data quality - Logical consistency: Iron concentrations are compared to diluted, commercially prepared stock solutions. Duplicate samples are measured to obtain estimates of variability.
Data quality - Completeness: Unknown
Lineage - Process steps:
  1. IOS and CRIEPI (Japan)

Distribution liability: [unknown]

Physical Sample Exists: N
